critique: This executive order establishes an Identity Theft Task Force to combat identity theft through law enforcement, public outreach, and improved data security. It involves multiple federal agencies and aims to coordinate efforts and provide advice to the President. There is little to suggest a strong ideological tilt. It doesn't directly address immigration. It could be argued that creating a task force expands executive power, but it also involves multiple agencies, suggesting a more collaborative approach. It centralizes authority at the federal level. It balances national security with civil liberties by focusing on protecting personal data. It involves government intervention in the economy by regulating data security. It promotes social inclusion by protecting individuals from identity theft.
